caption:
This photograph captures an expansive view from the deck of a ship traveling on blue waters, steering slightly right. The deck is dominated by a rich red color, contrasting vibrantly with the blue of the water and the sky. The ship is equipped with various nautical elements such as thick pipes, winches, and other maritime machinery, colored in a mix of red and yellow, complementing its utility and function.

In the distance, a city skyline emerges under a slightly hazy sky, indicating a warm, possibly humid day. The architecture of the city seems modern, suggesting a relatively developed urban area. The straight horizon line indicates calm sailing conditions.

The foreground of the image shows the left side of the ship extending towards the bow, guiding the viewer's gaze forward and into the scene. The ship leaves a trail of white foam in its wake, adding a sense of movement to the otherwise serene picture. The viewpoint suggests the photograph was taken from an elevated position on the ship, possibly near the captain's bridge or an upper deck, emphasizing a wide, unobstructed view of both the ship's operational surface and the urban coastline ahead.
title: Chemical dye in upper New York bay from a plant in Brooklyn New York.  Rivers in the region carry raw and partially digested sewage, and chemical and industrial wastes into the waters of the bight.  These wastes which accumulate in the rivers and bays bordering the bight present one of the most critical stresses to its environment
